entries.title: United States: Five former police officers charged with the murder of Tyre Nichols
entries.description: The five officers, who are also black, reportedly brutalized the young black man following a traffic stop. Video footage of the incident is schedule to be released Friday.

entries.title: Czech presidential candidate Andrej Babis exploits the fear of war
entries.description: The former prime minister is using the argument of 'peace' in the context of the War in Ukraine, to distance himself from his rival, the former general Petr Pavel, in the second round of voting on January 27 and 28.

entries.title: US infiltrates ransomware gang, servers seized
entries.description: Investigators were able to quietly provide decryption keys to victims of Hive, a highly active cybercriminal group.

entries.title: Canada to send four Leopard tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: The country is to ship four combat-ready tanks to the battlefield and says it could send more.

entries.title: Turkey's opposition in disarray ahead of presidential election
entries.description: With four months to go before the presidential election scheduled for May 14, the six-party coalition has yet to find a candidate.

entries.title: French pop icon Aya Nakamura appears in court
entries.description: The French-Malian singer and her former partner are accused of mutual domestic violence.

entries.title: Former French justice minister convicted in fake jobs case
entries.description: Michel Mercier, a minister of justice under former president Nicolas Sarkozy and an ex-senator, received a three-year suspended prison sentence on Thursday.

entries.title: Luxury giant LVMH posts record annual sales and profits
entries.description: The world's biggest luxury group benefited from the recovery of international travel following the Covid-19 pandemic.

entries.title: Scholz justifies timeframe of tank delivery to Ukraine
entries.description: Berlin's decision to allow the delivery of Leopard 2 tanks to Kyiv on Wednesday enables the German chancellor to silence critics, even within his coalition.

entries.title: M&M's are the new ludicrous battle in America's culture war
entries.description: The star presenter of Fow News has accused the 'spokescandies,' the candy manufacturer's mascots, of promoting so-called woke culture.

entries.title: Syrian refugees have become an electoral issue in Turkey
entries.description: A few months before the presidential and parliamentary elections on May 14, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan's ambition is to send home one million Syrian migrants and to reconcile with the Damascus regime.

entries.title: EU interior ministers want to step up deportations of rejected asylum seekers
entries.description: According to the EU border agency, some 330,000 people arrived illegally in 2022, up 64%. European ministers are due to meet in Stockholm to propose measures ahead of the special European Council in February.

entries.title: 'Smartphones, another example of the systemic effects of China's zero-Covid policy on global trade'
entries.description: The global smartphone market collapsed in the last quarter of 2022 due to the Chinese standstill, primarily affecting Korea and its flagship company Samsung. 'Le Monde' columnist Philippe Escande says this is another sign of saturation in this key market.

entries.title: Indian architect Balkrishna Doshi has died aged 95
entries.description: The 2018 Pritzker Prize winner, artist and disciple of Le Corbusier gained recognition for his innovative projects in social housing.

entries.title: China's health system comes under pressure from Covid-19 wave
entries.description: Beijing must learn lessons from the pandemic and rethink the organization of its hospital system.

entries.title: Stockholm launches campaign to discourage asylum seekers from coming to Sweden
entries.description: The liberal-conservative government and the far right hope to limit arrivals as much as possible with the help of a new marketing campaign.

entries.title: French rugby clubs reject president Laporte's replacement proposal
entries.description: Bernard Laporte was found guilty of corruption and favoritism in December 2022.

entries.title: Tanks for Ukraine: Sending a political message to Russia
entries.description: By agreeing on the delivery of heavy tanks, Kyiv's allies have demonstrated their ability to overcome their differences. This aid escalation is the direct consequence of Vladimir Putin's approach on the ground.

entries.title: French foreign minister arrives in Odesa to 'show France's support'
entries.description: UNESCO, the UN's cultural agency, on Wednesday designated the city's historic centre a 'World Heritage in Danger' site.

entries.title: German Leopard tanks to arrive in Ukraine by early April
entries.description: Germany will also start training Ukraine troops on Marder infantry fighting vehicles in the next days, said the defense minister.

entries.title: Why France is hesitating to deliver Leclerc tanks to Ukraine
entries.description: France's heavy armored vehicle stock is down to 226, and Paris has no immediate replacement solution.

entries.title: The dramatic fall of a former top FBI official suspected of working for Russian interests
entries.description: Charles McGonigal is said to have acted on behalf of Russian billionaire Oleg Deripaska, who is subject to American sanctions.

entries.title: Eel poaching at the heart of a political scandal in Sweden
entries.description: One of the prime minister's closest aides admitted to illegally fishing for this critically endangered species and lying to government officials who came to inspect his boat.

entries.title: Tesla announces record 2022 earnings despite economic downturn and supply chain problems
entries.description: The manufacturer made $12.5 billion in profit in 2022, compared to $5.5 billion the previous year.

entries.title: Israel raid in West Bank kills nine, say Palestinian authorities
entries.description: The Israeli raid took place in the Jenin refugee camp.

entries.title: Biden announces US is sending tanks to Kyiv in a sign of unity with Europe
entries.description: The 31 M1 Abrams tanks will not be delivered for a number of months, but the US president's decision marks a major turnaround and has unblocked aid from Germany.

entries.title: Civil disobedience: 'Climate scientists are citizens and humans too'
entries.description: An international group of researchers specializing in climate issues denounce the exclusion from the scientific community of Dr. Rose Abramoff and Dr. Peter Kalmus, who unfurled a banner calling for citizen action during a conference.

entries.title: 'Tár' review: Cate Blanchett at the top of her game
entries.description: The actress gives a talented performance as a brilliant conductor, a monster of intelligence and self-control swept up in the dizziness of power in Todd Field's third feature film.

entries.title: France recalls its ambassador from Burkina Faso
entries.description: The news comes as Burkina Faso asked France on Monday to withdraw its 400 troops currently stationed in the country, which Paris agreed to do.

entries.title: French comic book festival kicks off as authors feud over banned exhibition
entries.description: Ahead of the 50th edition of the Angoulême Comics Festival, an exhibition on artist Bastien Vivès was canceled after accusations of child pornography and his hateful comments on social media.

entries.title: Foreign interference plunges European Parliament into 'age of suspicion'
entries.description: Since revelations about Morocco and Qatar's attempts to influence the institution's decisions with cash, tongues have been wagging about several lawmakers' practices.

entries.title: 2023 César awards: Nominations reflect the public success of French cinema
entries.description: The nominations are led by two surprise successes of the year 2022, 'The Innocent' and 'The Night of the 12th'.

entries.title: Riad Sattouf, author of 'The Arab of the Future', wins France's top comics award
entries.description: The 44-year-old creator of 'L’Arabe du futur' ('The Arab of the Future') won the Grand Prix at the 50th annual Angoulême International Comics Festival, which opened on Thursday.

entries.title: Amazon faces first strike in the UK as workers walk out at Coventry warehouse
entries.description: Despite its refusal to recognize trade unions and its tactics of intimidating employees, the American company was not able to prevent the first British strike.

entries.title: United States vs Google: 'The risk is now existential for Google'
entries.description: The US Department of Justice has filed an antitrust lawsuit against the internet search giant over its advertisements. 'Le Monde' columnist Philippe Escande writes that the legal challenge is squarely aimed at the heart of Google's economic model.
